page.title: 08The mobile library in Ousden
page.content: Every 2 weeks the mobile library passes through the village, stopping at publicised places for 10 minutes for people to return and collect their books. The van is well stocked with books to suit all tastes, books for children, fiction and non-fiction and a selection of books with large print for those with eyesight difficulties. The mobile library is often a meeting place for not only the exchange of books, but an exchange of gossip, a friendly chat and a chance for people to meet their neighbours. The selection of books is changed fairly frequently. On the whole the most popular section is the fiction, novels are recommended from one reader to another. Books can be ordered from the main library at Mildenhall at a charge otherwise the service is free.
